revision.text: {{also|Xíngyáng}} ==English== {{wikipedia}} {{commonscat}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{q|from [[Wade–Giles]]}} {{l|en|Hsing-yang}} ===Etymology=== From the {{bor|en|cmn-pinyin|-}} romanization of {{bor|en|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|滎陽}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{rfp|en}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{place|en|county-level city|prefecture-level city/Zhengzhou|p/Henan|c/China}}. #* {{quote-journal |en |year=1979 |month=February |author=Chao Chien |title=The Chin Dynasty: Unified Fedual Rule |journal={{w|China Reconstructs}} |url=https://archive.org/details/cr196912/CR1974-03/ |publisher={{w|China Welfare Institute}} |volume=XXVIII |issue=2 |issn=0009-4447 |oclc=1554324 |page=63 |pageurl=https://archive.org/details/cr196912/CR1979-02/page/n64/ |text=Wu Kuang, who had been leading another army in an attack at '''Hsingyang''' (west of present-day Chengchow in Honan province), a strategic town held by the Chin forces, was killed by a subordinate officer. |brackets=on}} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1985 |last=Domes |first=Jürgen |chapter=Social Developments and Problems |title=The Government and Politics of the PRC: A Time of Transition |url=https://archive.org/details/governmentpoliti00jurg/ |publisher={{w|Westview Press}} |ISBN=0-86531-566-3 |LCCN=84-29939 |OCLC=1145273818 |OL=2866532M |page=216 |pageurl=https://archive.org/details/governmentpoliti00jurg/page/216/ |text=Only the teams continued to function as production units, but for them, the pre-1958 term "agricultural production cooperative" was now used again.⁶⁹ Similar provisions were suggested in a statement made by the secretary of the district (''ti-ch'ü'') PC of '''Hsingyang''' in Honan,⁷⁰ a move that seems particularly delicate because the district of '''Hsingyang''' includes Suip'ing ''hsien'', where, in mid-April 1958, the first people's commune in China had been established. |brackets=on}} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|county-level city in central China}} * Chinese: *: Mandarin: {{t+|cmn|滎陽|sc=Hani}}, {{t+|cmn|荥阳|tr=Xíngyáng|sc=Hani}} {{trans-mid}} * Japanese: {{t-needed|ja}} {{trans-bottom}}
